body: Your README meets specifications. If you’d like to learn how to take your README to the next level you should take the  **[Udacity Writing READMEs course](https://www.udacity.com/course/writing-readmes--ud777)**

You could also add a link to a hosted version.  You can publish your site on GitHub.io by going into the "Settings" tab of your repo:

![settings.PNG](https://udacity-reviews-uploads.s3.amazonaws.com/_attachments/4839/1496152840/settings.PNG)

Scroll down to the GitHub Pages box and choose which branch you want to use for the hosted game:

![branch.PNG](https://udacity-reviews-uploads.s3.amazonaws.com/_attachments/4839/1496152840/branch.PNG)

Click on "Save" and the URL for the hosted site will appear at the top of the box.

![published.PNG](https://udacity-reviews-uploads.s3.amazonaws.com/_attachments/4839/1496153100/published.PNG)
